raw_comment: I notice that overall more of the younger generations say the world is getting better over the older generations. I wonder why these countries were used over other countries. I also wonder what's different in Indonesia compared to Mali that causes such diverse responses from all their citizens. This connects to my community because I am considered a young adult so it makes me think what I would answer to this survery. Would I be in the 60% of young adults in the US that think the world is getting better? My catchy headline would be, "Do you believe in the future"
ace_sentences: More young people say that the world is getting better.
Fewer old people say that the world is getting better.
I wonder why the article uses these countries.
I wonder why the article does not use other countries.
I wonder what is different in Indonesia compared to Mali.
I wonder what causes diverse responses from citizens in Indonesia and citizens in Mali.
This topic connects to my community.
This topic makes me think about my answer to this survey.
Some young adults in the US think that the world is getting better.
60% of young adults in the US think that the world is getting better.
I wonder if I would be in this 60%.
The headline is: Do you believe in the future?
